intro: Arida, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in hot, dry climates and is often found growing on rocky soils or in sandy environments. Arida has a deep root system that allows it to access water from deeper underground, making it highly drought-resistant. Its ability to store water in its leaves makes it an important plant in desert ecosystems.
